subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Thursday, 10 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Owen included in England B squad
Newcastle striker Michael Owen is back in the England set-up after a long-term knee injury.



 
Shepherd tells Owen to stay loyal
Newcastle chairman Freddy Shepherd tells Michael Owen to show some loyalty and warns him none of the 'big four' clubs want to buy him.



 
Brown given three-game suspension
Fulham's Michael Brown is found guilty of headbutting Liverpool's Xabi Alonso and banned for three games.








GOLF




Players' Ch'ship leaderboard
Leading scores from the first round at Sawgrass.



 
Andalucia Open leaderboard
Latest updates from the European Tour event in Marbella.



 
Woods expects Sawgrass challenge
Tiger Woods insists anyone can win when the Players' Championship begins on Thursday.








MOTORSPORT




Valencia streets to host F1 GP
Valencia will host a Grand Prix around its streets from 2008.



 
Schumacher to attend Spanish GP
Michael Schumacher will attend a Grand Prix for the first time since his retirement.



 
Renault expect tough Spanish test
Formula One champions Renault still expect to be trailing Ferrari and McLaren at this week's Spanish Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE




Valencia streets to host F1 GP
Valencia will host a Grand Prix around its streets from 2008.



 
Schumacher to attend Spanish GP
Michael Schumacher will attend a Grand Prix for the first time since his retirement.



 
Renault expect tough Spanish test
Formula One champions Renault still expect to be trailing Ferrari and McLaren at this week's Spanish Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Legendary running track reopens
A £19m sports complex is opened at the historic site where Roger Bannister broke the four-minute mile.



 
Glasgow begins Commonwealth bid
Glasgow's official 2014 bid document  is on its way to London to be handed over to the Games Federation.



 
Mutai takes Belfast marathon win
Kenyan John Mutai comes close to a record time in claiming victory in the 26th Deep RiverRock Belfast City Marathon on Monday.








CYCLING




Hoy nervous ahead of record bid
Chris Hoy admits he is apprehensive about his bid to break the world kilometre record in Bolivia on Saturday.



 
Team suspends Hamilton from Giro
Tyler Hamilton and German Joerg Jaksche are suspended by their Tinkoff Credit Systems team for their involvement in the Operation Puerto doping scandal.



 
Wiggins claims Dunkirk prologue
British star Bradley Wiggins earns his first major time-trial win as a professional, the opening stage of the Four Days of Dunkirk race.
